content.rendered:
In order to protect the life of your car and its engine, car owners must change the oil and oil filter regularly. Luckily, when it comes to car maintenance, oil changes are quick and inexpensive. You can even do it yourself for those of you who enjoy getting your hands dirty and take pride in doing your own work.
Regular oil changes for your car are important here’s why:
1. The engine oil keeps components working smoothly together.
2. Oil draws heat away from the combustion chamber.
3. It helps prevent carbon and varnishes from accumulating in the engine.
What type of oil should I use, and how often?
Your owner’s manual will provide you with all the information necessary for your specific make and model. It’s important that you choose an oil that meets the automaker’s standards. The manual will also recommend how often to change your oil. In general, you can expect to change your oil about every 3,000 to 5,000 miles. Be sure to keep track of your mileage between oil changes.
Don’t Delay
An oil change is a good time to check the oil and be sure it’s not low or leaking; therefore, it’s best not to skip your oil change. Over time, your oil will get very dirty and even turn to sludge. You could also face very poor gas mileage and deplete the health of your engine.
